def.dt: :a close friend used especially to describe men or boys who are friends We've been buddies [=pals, (chiefly Brit) mates] since junior high school. He's one of my old army buddies. a buddy from college = a college buddy

dt.un: used to address a man who you do not know Hey, buddy, do you know where Maple Street is?

def.dt: :a person who does some activity with you His fishing buddy just bought a new boat. her drinking buddies [=the people who often drink alcohol with her]
:an arrangement in which two people help or protect each other If your children walk to school, have them use the buddy system. [=have them walk with other children]

:to become friendly especially in order to get help or some advantage often + with New students are encouraged to buddy up with older students. often + to businessmen buddying up to [=cozying up to] politicians to get their support
:telling a story about a friendship between two usually male characters a buddy movie/comedy
:very friendly or too friendly She's been buddy-buddy [=chummy] with the band for several years. He's a little too buddy-buddy with his professors.

:a group of related parts that move or work together a system of rivers railroad systems a security/telephone/heating system an alarm system a stereo/computer system see also ecosystem pa system public address system solar system sound system

:a body of a person or animal thought of as an entire group of parts that work together usually singular The disease affected her entire system. Greasy foods are not good for your system. No drugs were found in his system.
:a group of organs that work together to perform an important function of the body the digestive/reproductive/respiratory system see also central nervous system immune system nervous system

:a way of managing, controlling, organizing, or doing something that follows a set of rules or a plan the legal system The players like the coach's system. Under the new system, students will have to pass an exam to graduate. She devised a new filing system. We need a better system for handling incoming e-mail. often + of the state's system of education a democratic system of government Every religion has its own system of beliefs and practices. see also honor system metric system operating system
:a powerful government or social organization that controls people's lives You can't beat the system. We spent our youth rebelling against the system.

dro.dre: get it out of your system

def.dt: :to do something that you have been wanting to do so that you no longer feel a strong desire to do it You keep talking about making a cross-country trip. I think you just need to do it and get it out of your system.
:to get rid of a strong emotion (such as anger) by doing something He really angered her, so she went for a walk to get it out of her system.
